intro: Murtughas ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf murtughas, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for both aesthetic and traditional uses.
